lines.text: You know Ruby Ridge?
The old Burrell place, where they cut the top off the mountain.
You wanna have a look around?
I believe I won't.
I aim to settle down.
Ya should, Hector.
Raise a family.
It ain't men raises families.
All the kids with any get up and go, have got up and went just like you did. And the old ones are just hangin' on - like foxfire on rotten wood.
I do love this place, but I can't live here.
No, ya never could once ya was grow'd.
Hector honey, the Lord forgive me, but sometimes I get a little tired of what the Bible says.
She's lived here all her life and this ain't such a bad place to die.
Watcha knittin', Ma?
Socks. I'm bound to have somethin' in my hands to occupy my mind.
Got enough socks around here to do a centipede.

[taping an interview]
Did you ever shoot anyone?
Well if I did, I ain't gonna tell you about it.

[after whipping Dillard for lying to him]
I believe I'll go take a look at the mare now.
There's nothing wrong with her.
You said there was.
I lied, you gonna whip me too?
